creator: ncoleman@leanlogistics.com
text:
The manual for the debublevel attribute on the Core Javac ant task states the 
following:
"... If debuglevel is not specified, by default, :none will be appended to -g. 
If debug is not turned on, this attribute will be ignored. "


This is incorrect since what actually happens is as follows:
If debug is not turned on, the value -g:none is appended by default.  If debug 
is turned on and debuglevel is not specified, -g is appended.

The part about -g:none may be valid to add to the notes about the debug 
attribute as well.
